item.title: Comment on The Long-Run Impacts of Banning Affirmative Action in US Higher Education by Crusader
item.description:
Are academics paid per word now?

I also tried skimming it and found this total gem in reference to the data set they used “We also exclude Asians because the vast majority of the Asian population in the treated states lives in California.”

Maybe I’m the stupid one but it’s hard to imagine why you’d exclude Asian people in California, of all states, in your analysis of the effects of banning affirmative action.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/08/the-long-run-impacts-of-banning-affirmative-action-in-us-higher-education.html?commentID=160792811

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/08/the-long-run-impacts-of-banning-affirmative-action-in-us-higher-education.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=the-long-run-impacts-of-banning-affirmative-action-in-us-higher-education

item.title: Comment on Monday assorted links by Natasha Bertrand
item.description:
Reply to Tyler:

That was a fake Tyler announcing comments will be closed. That is not the case. We are diligently working on finding a solution.

BREAKING: Economist Tyler Cowen is reportedly in discussions with Substack to relocate his popular blog, Marginal Revolution, to the platform. This move comes in response to a recent surge in inappropriate comments on his current site, prompting concerns about maintaining a respectful and constructive discussion environment for his readers. The transition aims to leverage Substack's robust moderation tools to enhance the quality of discourse. Further details on the potential move are expected to be released soon.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/08/monday-assorted-links-468.html?commentID=160792881

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/08/monday-assorted-links-468.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=monday-assorted-links-468
